full_summary:
### Tenders
#### EP168-222468 Portage Channel Bridge Replacement

**Government of Canada**

### Request for Proposal

A Request for Proposal (RFP) has been issued by the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) for the Portage Channel Bridge Replacement.

### Tender Details

* **Tender Reference**: WS3822538326
* **Solicitation Reference**: WS3822538326-Doc3822708674
* **Amendment Number**: 6
* **Amendment Date**: February 10, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: February 16, 2023, 2:00 PM EST

### Description of Work

The PSPC is seeking proposals for the replacement of the Portage Channel Bridge.

### Documents

To access the RFP and required documents, please visit the [CanadaBuys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/fr/) webpage and register for an account if needed. Companies new to PSPC's online procurement tool can consult the [CanadaBuys Getting Started](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/fr/obtenir-de-laide) page for necessary steps.

### Evaluation Criteria

Bidders will be assessed on technical merit and price.

### Agreement Criteria

The selected bidder will be required to complete a contract under the terms of the [Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)](https://www.international.gc.ca/trade-commerce/trade-agreements-accords-commerciaux/agr-acc/ceta-aecg.aspx?lang=eng).

### Agreement Types

The following Trade Agreements apply to this contract:

*   Canada-UE (CETA)
*   Canada-Ukraine (CUFTA)

### Bidding Requirements

All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted by the tender closing date. Bids submitted after the closure will not be considered.

### Contact Information

*   Name: Marc Lanthier
*   Email: marc.lanthier@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Tender Status

This tender is Past the Tentative Due Date.

### Regions of Opportunity

Ontario (excluding NCR) and National Capital Region (NCR).The rewritten entry includes the key information as required, is succinct and professional. 


I'd be happy to provide further assistance if needed. Let me know what you think!
